item.title: Utblick no.4 "Africa?"
item.description:
About

Utblick no.4 “Africa?” explores the complexity of a continent often reduced to singular narratives. The editorial design reflects this theme through bold geometric patterns and warm earth tones, creating visual rhythm while maintaining the structured clarity needed for political journalism.

Working with a limited palette—warm orange and black on uncoated paper—the design emphasizes materiality and craft. Hand-drawn map elements and geometric motifs provide visual breaks between articles without overwhelming the content. The typographic system balances dense political analysis with breathing space, using clean hierarchies for article text, editor’s notes, and quoted material.

This issue demonstrates how editorial design can support complex subject matter—creating a consistent visual language while allowing the content’s nuance to remain central.

item.title: Things in a Conversation
item.description:
About

Conversing is probably not an activity that would be expected between any objects, hence it breaks with certain preconceived expectations. Both in how the objects could be understood, but also in how the perception of the conversation is to be interpreted in this situation. What are they, and what are they talking about?

item.title: Nylokal Brand Identity
item.description:
Challenge

Lokalguiden identified an opportunity to serve newly opened businesses with a dedicated service. Nylokal needed its own brand identity to appeal to entrepreneurs and startup businesses while maintaining connection to Lokalguiden’s trusted brand.

Approach

Brand Strategy

  • Positioned Nylokal as fresh, energetic, and startup-friendly
  • Created visual identity that feels approachable and modern
  • Balanced distinctiveness with Lokalguiden family resemblance

Visual Identity

  • Developed logo and brand guidelines
  • Created color palette and typography system
  • Designed marketing materials and templates

Solution

  • Energetic brand identity appealing to new business owners
  • Flexible visual system for various marketing applications
  • Clear brand guidelines ensuring consistent implementation
  • Marketing materials ready for campaign launches

Impact

  • Successful launch of new service line targeting emerging businesses
  • Distinct identity helped differentiate offering in market
  • Visual system enabled quick deployment of marketing campaigns
  • Brand resonated with target entrepreneur audience

Role

Art Director – Led brand identity development including logo design, visual guidelines, and marketing materials.

item.title: Lokalguiden Brand Refresh 2020
item.description:
Challenge

As Lokalguiden evolved from a primarily print-based business directory to a digital-first platform, the brand identity needed to reflect this transformation. The existing visual language felt outdated and didn’t convey the modern, user-friendly digital experience the company was building.

Approach

Research & Discovery

  • Analyzed competitor positioning in the digital directory space
  • Interviewed stakeholders to understand business goals and user needs
  • Audited existing brand touchpoints (print magazine, website, marketing materials)

item.title: Design Thinking Essentials
item.description:
Design thinking is more than a methodology—it’s a mindset that helps solve complex problems through a human-centered approach.

Core Principles

After working on numerous projects across different industries, I’ve found these principles consistently valuable:

1. Empathy First

Understanding the user’s needs, pain points, and context is the foundation of effective design. Before sketching or prototyping, invest time in research and observation.

2. Define the Problem Clearly

A well-defined problem is halfway to a solution. Take time to articulate what you’re actually trying to solve.
